channel.title: Web APIs :: C# Web Development
channel.description: An API, or application programming interface, is a set of rules that allow one application to communicate with another application. Web APIs are how applications communicate with other applications over a network. Throughout the remainder of this chapter, we will explore web APIs and a pattern for organizing them called REST. REST is an application design pattern, not unlike MVC. REST, however, relies on an abstract concept called application state that weâ€™ll cover in more detail on the following pages.
